newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's Bozano to open brokerage in Argentina.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's Bozano to open brokerage in Argentina.

text.p: Brazilian private bank Banco Bozano, Simonsen plans to open a brokerage house in Argentina by the end of this semester, said the bank's president Paulo Ferraz.
The brokerage, which still needs to be approved by the Argentine authorities, would be the first stage of Bozano's plans to set up what he termed as an investment bank in Argentina.
"We initially will open a brokerage but our intention is to have an investment bank in Argentina to do the same business we do here," Ferraz said.
With $5.0 billion in total assets and a $500 million net worth, Bozano, Simonsen focus on capital markets, investment banking, privatizations, corporate finance and asset management.
Ferraz added Bozano plans to open branches in other Latin American countries, including Chile, Colombia, Peru and Mexico.
"We want to follow our clients who are looking for business in Latin America," he said. "We believe that, in five or 10 years, investors will be seeking Latin banks."
Bozano, Simonsen would be the first Brazilian investment bank to open a branch in Argentina.
Last year the bank posted a $165 million net profit, up from $75 million in 1995, Ferraz said.
